section.title: What inspired me?
section.para: We had to do perform load and stress testing of our JAX-WS API and tag libraries. In doing so we found different tools for performing the tasks we needed to for our purpose. For example, for web service we could have used soapUI, for tag lib tesing we could have used either JMeter or HttpUnit. Though the tag lib testing was quite obvious the JAX-WS API testing was not that obvious and we need to ensure the API was supposed to handle what its supposed to recieve. Doing so would have required writing over-complicated XML authoring, whereas it could be achieved entirely by pure Java code. So we also needed to be able to test them. Adding more challenge to it was being able to test creation of different entities with different randomized values and execution of different test cases with delay with respect to starting point. Also I wanted to perform all the tests from one platfor rather than using multiple of them; please note that all the tools mentioned earlier are great tools in their own but using them all together was a distant possibility.

section.title: Goal
section.para: The goal of the project is quite large in deed, but I want to achieve it in different steps rather than going for at once. So I would in fact represent the goal in a roadmap fashion.

listitem.para: Add an API for adding load testing engines
Default Engine implementation will be provided.
It will support time-thread based test case execution.
Add an API for adding test instances for any API, for example, soapUI, JMeter, HttpUnit, etc.
There will be API implementation for executing pure Java codes only in this release
Support for HttpUnit is probable for enabling www pages.
Add an API for persisting test results to DB, FileSystem etc.
Add an basic UI for monitoring test and showing test results, in this release the UI will be console based.
Add NetBeans RCP support in UI layer
Add graphical representation for test results
Add soapUI support for test cases support
Enhance UI support for the framework
